title: Maximum value of a function from its derivative

content.question: Let f be a function whose derivative is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>28</mn></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGacaakiaakoabaaa aaaaaapeGabmOzayaafaWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGL PaaacqGH9aqpciGGSbGaaiOBamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG4bWdamaaCa aaleqabaWdbiaaisdaaaGccqGHRaWkcaaI1aGaamiEa8aadaahaaWc beqaa8qacaaIZaaaaOGaey4kaSIaamiEa8aadaahaaWcbeqaa8qaca aIYaaaaOGaeyOeI0IaaG4naiaadIhacqGHRaWkcaaIYaGaaGioaaGa ayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@4F73@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. On the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGacaakiaakoabaaa aaaaaapeWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiabgkHiTiaaisdacaGGSaWdaiaaysW7 peGaaGymaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@3FF1@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, at which of the following values of x does f attain a relative maximum?

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema
